intro: Denhamia fasciculiflora, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rockheath, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in coastal or inland areas with a warm climate. Denhamia fasciculiflora is an evergreen shrub that can reach heights of up to 1.5 meters.
